alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 3:20PM EDT until July 30 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Water enters the basement of a home off of Highway 30 on the right bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 29.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EDT Thursday was 29.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.3 feet on 04/13/1972. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued 9 PM EDT.
